data.title: Twitter Earnings: TWTR Stock Takes 17% Jump on Strong User Growth
data.text:
Twitter (TWTR) earnings for the social media company's fourth quarter of 2019 have TWTR stock taking off Thursday as users grow.
The post Twitter Earnings: TWTR Stock Takes 17% Jump on Strong User Growth appeared first on InvestorPlace.

data.title: Twitter shares soar after first $1 billion quarter
data.text: Shares of Twitter soared more than 18 percent higher on Thursday after the social network reported its largest-ever user growth in a quarter. The bite-sized communications platform also raked in $1 billion in quarterly revenue for the first time ever, surpassing Wall Street’s expectations amid efforts to make itself more user-friendly in part by eliminating.

data.title: Twitter notches first $1 billion quarterly revenue, beating estimates; shares jump
data.text: Twitter Inc  pulled in $1 billion in quarterly revenue for the first time on Thursday, beating expectations as efforts to make its platform more user-friendly brought in more people, and sending its shares up 14% in early trading.

data.text:
The all-important monetizable daily active users (mDAU) metric rose to 152 million, up from 145 million last quarter and up from 126 million Q4 2018.
Twitter has just announced its Q4 earnings for fiscal 2019.

data.title: Twitter Earnings Miss, But TWTR Stock Jumps On Strong User Growth
data.text: Twitter earnings fell short of Q4 estimates, but revenue and user growth were strong. TWTR stock rose sharply before Thursday's open.

data.title: Twitter reports $1.01B in Q4 revenues with 152M monetizable daily active users
data.text: As Twitter continues to try to find the right balance between making its platform easier to use while also less prone to toxicity and abuse, the social media company reported mixed earnings for Q4. Twitter posted $1.01 billion in sales — notable because it is the first time its revenues have broken past the billion-dollar mark — […]

data.title: Twitter’s Q4 User, Sales Beat Street In Key Quarter, Stock Pops
data.text: Twitter early Thursday posted $1.01 billion in fourth-quarter revenue, beating Wall Street estimates in a crucial quarter that’s being heavily scrutinized after some glitches in its advertising products resulted in disappointing  sales growth in the quarter before. Earnings of 0.25 per share came it below estimates (of between 0.27-0.29 cents). Net income was $118.8 million.

data.title: Twitter tops expectations with first $1 billion quarterly revenue, but outlook lags
data.text: Twitter Inc  hit $1 billion in quarterly revenue for the first time, topping expectations and also beating user growth estimates in a rebound from previous troubles with ad platform bugs and unusually low seasonal demand.
